topPRs.title: feat(server): Add x402 payment middleware to Jobs API
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary

This PR adds x402 payment middleware integration to the Jobs API, enabling cryptocurrency payments for AI agent access.

## Key Features

### Flexible Authentication Modes
- **Both API key + x402 enabled**: Requires BOTH `X-API-KEY` AND `X-PAYMENT` headers
- **Only API key** (x402=false): Requires only `X-API-KEY` header  
- **Only x402** (no API token): Requires only `X-PAYMENT` header
- **Neither enabled**: No authentication required

### Environment-Based Configuration
All settings via `.env` variables:
- `X402_ENABLED` - Enable/disable payment middleware
- `X402_WALLET_ADDRESS` - Receiving wallet address
- `X402_PRICE` - Price in USDC (default: $0.01)
- `X402_NETWORK` - Blockchain network (default: base-sepolia)
- `X402_USE_MAINNET` - Use CDP facilitator for production
- `CDP_API_KEY_ID`/`CDP_API_KEY_SECRET` - Required for mainnet

### Auto-Discovery
Endpoints automatically listed in x402 Bazaar (mainnet) with:
- Full JSON schemas (input/output)
- Descriptive documentation
- Pricing information

## Files Changed

### New Files
- `packages/server/src/middleware/x402.ts` - Main middleware implementation
- `packages/server/src/middleware/__tests__/x402.test.ts` - Comprehensive test suite (12 tests)
- `docs/x402-payment-integration.md` - Full documentation

### Modified Files  
- `packages/server/src/middleware/index.ts` - Export x402 middleware
- `packages/server/src/api/messaging/jobs.ts` - Integrated x402 on POST /jobs route
- `packages/server/package.json` - Added x402 dependencies
- `bun.lock` - Lockfile update

## Dependencies Added
- `x402-express@0.7.0` - Express middleware for x402 protocol
- `@coinbase/x402@0.7.0` - CDP facilitator for mainnet

## Testing

‚úÖ All 12 unit tests passing  
‚úÖ Build successful
‚úÖ No linter errors
‚úÖ TypeScript types validated

Run tests:
```bash
cd packages/server
bun test src/middleware/__tests__/x402.test.ts
```

## Documentation

See `docs/x402-payment-integration.md` for:
- Complete setup instructions
- Configuration examples
- Testing guide
- Security considerations
- Troubleshooting

## Breaking Changes

None - x402 is disabled by default and completely optional.

## References

- [x402 Protocol Docs](https://docs.cdp.coinbase.com/x402/)
- [x402 Quickstart for Sellers](https://docs.cdp.coinbase.com/x402/quickstart-for-sellers)
- [Coinbase Developer Platform](https://cdp.coinbase.com)

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Integrates x402 crypto payments into POST /api/messaging/jobs with env-configurable pricing/networks, adds docs/tests, and required dependencies.
> 
> - **Server/Middleware**:
>   - Add x402 payment middleware `createX402Middleware` and `x402LoggingMiddleware` in `packages/server/src/middleware/x402.ts`; export via `middleware/index.ts`.
>   - Supports dual auth: API key and/or x402 (`X-API-KEY`, `X-PAYMENT`) with env-based config (`X402_*`, `CDP_*`).
> - **API**:
>   - Protect `POST /api/messaging/jobs` using x402; includes route metadata (input/output schemas) for Bazaar discovery.
> - **Docs/Tests**:
>   - Add `docs/x402-payment-integration.md` with setup, modes, and examples.
>   - Add unit tests `packages/server/src/middleware/__tests__/x402.test.ts`.
> - **Dependencies**:
>   - Add `x402-express`, `@coinbase/x402`; update `packages/server/package.json`.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 57ae3cf5914a740335e67133ada19951df0125e5. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

topPRs.title: [DRAFT] feat(core): Implement parallel action execution in processActions
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary

This PR implements parallel action execution within the `processActions()` method to improve performance for multi-action responses.

## Changes

### Core Runtime (`packages/core/src/runtime.ts`)
- Execute actions within a single response batch **in parallel** using `Promise.allSettled()`
- All actions in a batch receive the **same initial state snapshot**
- State accumulates **sequentially between response batches**
- Merge all `ActionResult.values` after parallel batch completes
- Preserve fault tolerance: if one action fails, others still complete

### Prompts (`packages/core/src/prompts.ts`)
- Updated `messageHandlerTemplate` to reflect parallel execution model
- Changed "IMPORTANT ACTION ORDERING RULES" to "IMPORTANT ACTION EXECUTION RULES"
- Clarified that actions listed in a single response execute in parallel
- Added guidance to use multi-step workflow for sequential dependencies

### Action State Provider (`packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/providers/actionState.ts`)
- Updated JSDoc and description to clarify "previous results" refers to prior response batches, not sibling parallel actions

### Tests
- Updated `runtime.test.ts` to match new state initialization behavior
- Updated `prompts.test.ts` to match new prompt text

## Key Data Flow

```
Response 1: [action1, action2, action3]
  ‚îú‚îÄ> Execute ALL in parallel with initialState
  ‚îú‚îÄ> Wait for all to complete
  ‚îî‚îÄ> Merge results ‚Üí accumulatedState

Response 2: [action4, action5]
  ‚îú‚îÄ> Execute ALL in parallel with accumulatedState from Response 1
  ‚îú‚îÄ> Wait for all to complete
  ‚îî‚îÄ> Merge results ‚Üí new accumulatedState
```

## Testing

- All existing runtime tests pass
- All prompt tests pass
- All multi-step workflow tests pass
- Action chaining tests pass

## Breaking Changes

None - backward compatible. Actions that previously assumed sequential execution within a batch will now run in parallel, but since they all receive the same state snapshot, behavior should be equivalent for independent actions.

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Execute actions in a response batch in parallel with a shared state snapshot, accumulate results across batches, and introduce AsyncLocalStorage-based prompt tracking with prompt/provider/test updates.
> 
> - **Core (runtime.ts)**:
>   - Parallelize `processActions` per response using `Promise.allSettled()`; each batch shares a composed state snapshot; accumulate `ActionResult.values` and plan state between batches.
>   - Add robust action resolution (exact/fuzzy/similes), error paths for missing action/handler, and consistent action memory/logging.
>   - Preserve legacy returns (void/boolean) as completed; treat `{ success:false }` (including minimal/error-only) as failed.
>   - Merge working memory with size cap; cache `action_results`; update action plan immutably per step.
>   - Introduce AsyncLocalStorage context: `ActionContextStore`, `getCurrentActionContext`, and browser fallback `createBrowserFallback` for prompt collection; include action context in `useModel` logs; skip collecting `TEXT_EMBEDDING` prompts.
> - **Prompts (prompts.ts)**:
>   - Update `messageHandlerTemplate` for parallel execution model and guidance on multi-step dependencies.
> - **Provider (plugin-bootstrap/actionState.ts)**:
>   - Clarify description/docs: "previous results" are from prior response batches; parallel actions share the same snapshot.
> - **Tests**:
>   - Expand `runtime.test.ts`: parallel execution behavior, action result status semantics, prompt collection/isolation via AsyncLocalStorage, browser fallback behavior, exact vs fuzzy action matching.
>   - Update `prompts.test.ts` for new execution rules and wording.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 55765fc289c965232d5d690c363f73c7ea1b81f6. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

topPRs.title: fix(server): standardize message server route naming
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
## fix(server): standardize message server route naming

### Problem

The `api-client` package was calling `/message-servers/*` routes that didn't exist on the server. The server had inconsistent naming with `/servers/*` routes instead.

```
Client calls:  POST /message-servers
Server had:    POST /servers          ‚Üí 404!
```

### Solution

- Renamed `/servers/*` ‚Üí `/message-servers/*`
- Renamed `:serverId` ‚Üí `:messageServerId`
- Added deprecated routes with forwarding for backward compatibility

### Routes Changed

| Old Route | New Route |
|-----------|-----------|
| `POST /servers` | `POST /message-servers` |
| `GET /servers/:serverId/agents` | `GET /message-servers/:messageServerId/agents` |
| `POST /servers/:serverId/agents` | `POST /message-servers/:messageServerId/agents` |
| `DELETE /servers/:serverId/agents/:agentId` | `DELETE /message-servers/:messageServerId/agents/:agentId` |

### Backward Compatibility

Old routes still work but log deprecation warnings:
```
[DEPRECATED] POST /servers is deprecated. Use POST /message-servers instead.
```

### Tests

- Added 17 unit tests for route naming conventions
- All 420 server unit tests pass

topPRs.title: fix: Enable hot reload for backend development
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary

Implements comprehensive hot reload functionality for backend development. When TypeScript files in watched packages are modified, the system automatically rebuilds the CLI and restarts the server with health verification.

Previously, `bun run dev` only built the CLI once and ran it without watching for file changes. Backend code modifications required manually restarting the dev server.

## Changes

### Core Functionality
- ‚úÖ Add file watching for all CLI dependency packages:
  - `packages/cli/src`, `packages/core/src`, `packages/server/src`
  - `packages/api-client/src`, `packages/plugin-bootstrap/src`
  - `packages/plugin-sql/src`, `packages/config/src`
- ‚úÖ Implement automatic rebuild and server restart on file changes
- ‚úÖ Add 300ms debounce to prevent rapid rebuilds
- ‚úÖ Handle graceful server shutdown with SIGTERM/SIGKILL fallback
- ‚úÖ Server health check verification after rebuilds
- ‚úÖ Rebuild queueing for changes during active rebuilds

### Code Quality (Addressing PR Reviews)
- ‚úÖ **Replace Node.js spawn with Bun.spawn()** per project standards (CLAUDE.md)
- ‚úÖ **Add comprehensive TypeScript type annotations** with JSDoc throughout
- ‚úÖ **Fix SIGKILL fallback** using exit event listeners instead of killed property
- ‚úÖ **Add directory existence checks** before fs.watch to handle optional packages
- ‚úÖ **Fix server crash detection** - health check now runs after every rebuild
- ‚úÖ **Implement rebuild queueing** - file changes during rebuilds no longer dropped
- ‚úÖ **Update tests** to use temp directory instead of source directory (CI/CD compatible)
- ‚úÖ **Convert to ES6 imports** - removed all Node.js require() statements

### Testing
- ‚úÖ Create comprehensive test suite (13 tests, all passing)
- ‚úÖ Tests verify: watch targets, debounce, rebuild behavior, TypeScript filtering, cleanup, Bun.spawn usage, rebuild queueing, directory checks, exit events, health checks

## How It Works

When you run `bun run dev`, the script:
1. Builds and starts the CLI server
2. Waits for health check (GET /api/server/ping)
3. Starts the Vite dev server for frontend
4. **NEW:** Watches all backend source directories for `.ts`/`.tsx` file changes
5. **NEW:** On file change:
   - Debounces 300ms to batch rapid changes
   - Stops server gracefully (SIGTERM with SIGKILL fallback)
   - Rebuilds CLI package
   - Restarts server and waits for health check
   - Queues additional changes if they occur during rebuild

## Test Results

```bash
‚úÖ All 13 tests passing
‚úÖ Build successful (15/15 packages)
‚úÖ No TypeScript errors
```

**Test coverage includes:**
- File watcher configuration
- Debounce mechanism
- Server shutdown/restart
- TypeScript file filtering
- Cleanup handling
- Rebuild queueing
- Directory existence checks
- SIGKILL fallback behavior
- Health check after rebuild
- Bun.spawn usage verification

## Benefits

- üîÑ Backend now has hot reload similar to frontend's Vite HMR
- ‚ö° Faster development workflow - no manual restarts needed
- üéØ Watches all relevant packages - changes anywhere trigger rebuilds
- üõ°Ô∏è Debouncing prevents rebuild storms from multiple file saves
- üè• Health checks ensure server is responsive after rebuild
- üì¶ Queuing ensures no changes are lost during rebuilds
- üîí Follows project standards (Bun.spawn, TypeScript annotations)

## Demo

After running `bun run dev`, modify any backend file:
```
[WATCH] üìù File changed in cli: index.ts
[REBUILD] üîÑ Rebuilding CLI...
[REBUILD] Stopping server...
[REBUILD] Server stopped gracefully
[REBUILD] ‚úÖ Build completed, restarting server...
[HEALTH] Waiting for server to be ready...
[HEALTH] ‚úÖ Server is ready! (attempt 1)
[REBUILD] ‚úÖ Server restarted successfully!
```

## Review Status

All critical and important issues from PR reviews have been addressed:

| Issue | Status | Fix |
|-------|--------|-----|
| Node.js spawn instead of Bun.spawn | ‚úÖ Fixed | Now uses Bun.spawn() throughout |
| Missing TypeScript types | ‚úÖ Fixed | Comprehensive JSDoc annotations added |
| Server crash detection flaw | ‚úÖ Fixed | Health check after every rebuild |
| SIGKILL fallback never executes | ‚úÖ Fixed | Uses exit event listener |
| Missing directory existence checks | ‚úÖ Fixed | Checks before fs.watch() |
| File changes during rebuild dropped | ‚úÖ Fixed | Rebuild queueing implemented |
| Test fails in read-only environments | ‚úÖ Fixed | Uses temp directory |
| Node.js require() in tests | ‚úÖ Fixed | ES6 imports only |

**Reviewers:** @cursor, @greptile-apps, @claude

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Enables reliable backend hot reload and modernizes the dev runner.
> 
> - Overhauls `scripts/dev-watch.js` to watch backend packages (`cli`, `core`, `server`, `api-client`, `plugin-bootstrap`, `plugin-sql`, `config`) for `.ts/.tsx` changes and trigger CLI rebuild + server restart
> - Adds debounce (300ms) and rebuild queueing; waits for health check (`/api/server/ping`) after each restart
> - Replaces Node `spawn` usage with `Bun.spawn`, adds JSDoc types, and improves cross-platform package name resolution
> - Implements graceful shutdown with `SIGTERM` and `SIGKILL` fallback using exit promises; robust cleanup for processes and file watchers
> - Adds comprehensive tests in `scripts/__tests__/dev-watch.test.ts` covering watch targets, debounce, rebuild behavior, TypeScript filtering, cleanup, queueing, directory existence checks, exit handling, health checks, and Bun usage
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 80105c84ab174d999aadc0615fb8fb8e71a09f81. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

topPRs.title: docs(plugin-dummy-services): add comprehensive README
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary Added comprehensive README.md documentation for the `@elizaos/plugin-dummy-services` package. ## Documentation Includes - Package overview and purpose - Installation instructions (using bun) - Table of all 9 available dummy services with service types - Full plugin usage example - Individual service import examples - Detailed API documentation for each service: - DummyTokenDataService - DummyLpService - DummyWalletService - DummyPdfService - DummyVideoService - DummyBrowserService - DummyTranscriptionService - DummyWebSearchService - DummyEmailService - Guide on when to use dummy vs real services - Testing information ## Test plan - [x] README follows project documentation style - [x] Code examples are accurate based on source files ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code) --- > [!NOTE] > Provides full documentation for `@elizaos/plugin-dummy-services` to enable testing agents without external dependencies. > > - Adds detailed README with installation, full-plugin and per-service usage examples > - Documents APIs for 9 dummy services (`token_data`, `lp`, `wallet`, `pdf`, `video`, `browser`, `transcription`, `web_search`, `email`) with code snippets > - Includes guidance on when to use dummy vs real services and basic testing instructions > > Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit a62e249df71d7d66d8c350c894ea7d8dfaed3d5d. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).

Greptile Summary

Added comprehensive README documentation for the `@elizaos/plugin-dummy-services` package. The README provides detailed API documentation for all 9 dummy services with usage examples, installation instructions, and guidance on when to use dummy vs real services. The PR also includes unrelated improvements to multi-step workflow functionality: - Enhanced parameter extraction and formatting in multi-step actions - Added retry logic for XML parsing failures with exponential backoff - Improved streaming support for multi-step workflows - Added comprehensive test coverage for retry logic and parameter handling **Key additions:** - Complete service API documentation with code examples for each service - Usage patterns for both plugin-wide and individual service imports - Decision matrix for when to use dummy services vs real services - Testing information and examples

Confidence Score: 4/5

- This PR is safe to merge with minor considerations - The README documentation is comprehensive, accurate, and well-structured. The multi-step workflow improvements include proper error handling, retry logic, and test coverage. Score is 4/5 due to the PR containing multiple unrelated commits beyond just the documentation (title claims only docs, but includes 6 other commits with core functionality changes) - No files require special attention. All changes are well-implemented with proper error handling and test coverage

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | packages/plugin-dummy-services/README.md | Added comprehensive documentation for the dummy services plugin with API examples and usage guidance | | packages/core/src/prompts.ts | Updated prompts for multi-step workflows with parameter handling instructions | | packages/core/src/runtime.ts | Enhanced runtime with retry logic and improved error handling for multi-step actions | | packages/core/src/services/default-message-service.ts | Significantly enhanced message service with streaming support, action chaining, and improved logging | | packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/__tests__/multi-step.test.ts | Added comprehensive test suite for multi-step action workflows with various scenarios | | packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/providers/actions.ts | Enhanced actions provider with improved parameter formatting and action result tracking |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User participant MessageService participant Runtime participant LLM participant Action participant Provider User->>MessageService: Send message MessageService->>MessageService: Check USE_MULTI_STEP setting alt Multi-Step Mode loop For each step (max iterations) MessageService->>Runtime: composeState() Runtime-->>MessageService: State with context MessageService->>Runtime: Generate decision prompt Runtime->>LLM: Decision request with actionsWithParams loop Retry with exponential backoff LLM-->>Runtime: XML response Runtime->>Runtime: parseKeyValueXml() alt Parse Success Runtime-->>MessageService: Parsed step (thought, action, parameters, providers, isFinish) Note over Runtime,MessageService: Break retry loop else Parse Failure Runtime->>Runtime: Wait with exponential backoff end end alt Has Parameters MessageService->>MessageService: Extract parameters (JSON or object) MessageService->>MessageService: Store in state.data.actionParams end alt Has Providers MessageService->>Provider: Call provider.get() Provider-->>MessageService: Context data MessageService->>MessageService: Update state end alt Has Action MessageService->>Action: Execute with parameters from state Action-->>MessageService: ActionResult MessageService->>MessageService: Store result in traceActionResult end alt isFinish == true Note over MessageService: Exit loop end end MessageService->>Runtime: Generate summary prompt Runtime->>LLM: Summary request with action history loop Retry summary parsing LLM-->>Runtime: XML summary response Runtime->>Runtime: parseKeyValueXml() alt Parse Success Runtime-->>MessageService: Summary with thought and text else Parse Failure Runtime-->>MessageService: Fallback summary end end MessageService->>User: Final response with summary else Single-Shot Mode MessageService->>Runtime: processActions() Runtime->>Action: Execute action Action-->>Runtime: Result Runtime-->>MessageService: Response MessageService->>User: Direct response end ```
